page.title: 12HOUSING IN OUR AREA
page.content: The typical house in this area is a stone-built cottage with a slated roof,dating mainly from late 19th Century and early 20th Century.Most of these were built to house farm workers(and some for those who worked in the now-defunct shale-mining industry),but most are now owned by people who work outside the area. Newton village has,in addition to the above type of housing,a'scheme'of houses built,in the 1930's by the local authority.The small section of Queensferry which abuts this area contains private housing of the timber-frame variety built within the last six or eight years.
